DataElement.preferredDefinition: The length of the biopsy core involved by tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body and their characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease).:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.

Concepts.definition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The range, magnitude, or distance of the diagnostic biopsy specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease).:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
